simple.name: interface
simple.description: The network interface you intend to be present or blank if no check is needed. Do not include the VLAN in the interface name. (eg. For eth0.28 the interface should be set to "eth0" NOT "eth0.28").

simple.name: ip_address
simple.description: For the unicast case this is the destination IP address to send the UDP packets. For the multicast case this is the multicast group.

simple.name: port
simple.description: UDP port used to publish data.

simple.name: vlan
simple.description: Virtual Lan address to use. Ignored if set to 0.

struct.description: Settings related to standard fields in the SDDS Packet or data portion which cannot be derived from BulkIO metadata.

simple.name: standard_format
simple.description: The SF (Standard Format) field is used to identify whether or not the packet conforms to the SDDS standard. For SDDS standard packets, the SF bit shall be set to a value of 1. The SF bit shall be set to a value of zero for non-standard packets.

simple.name: original_format
simple.description: The OF (Original Format) field identifies the original format of the data transmitted. If the data was originally offset binary and has been converted to 2's complement, the OF value is set to one. Otherwise, the data is 2's complement and has not been converted and the OF value is set to zero.

simple.name: spectral_sense
simple.description: The SS (Spectral Sense) field identifiees whether or not the spectral sense has been inverted from the original input. The SS value is set to one if the spectral sense has been inverted. The SS value is set to zero if the spectral sense has not been inverted.

simple.name: endian_representation
simple.description: The endianness (Big or Little) of the data portion of the SDDS packet. Defaults to Network Byte Order (Big Endian). This will also affect the SRI keyword DATA_REF_STR and set it appropriately

struct.name: sdds_attach_settings
struct.description: Settings related to the BulkIO based SDDS Attach and detach API.

simple.name: time_tag_valid
simple.description: Used only in the attach call. The attach call is made prior to the bulkIO TimeStamp being available so the true BULKIO::TCS_VALID flag cannot be checked. This is only used during the call to attach.

simple.name: user_id
simple.description: Used as a parameter to the attach call.

simple.name: downstream_give_sri_priority
simple.description: Informs downstream components, via the BULKIO_SRI_PRIORITY keyword, to override the xdelta and real/complex mode found in the SDDS Packet header in place of the xdelta and mode found in the supplied SRI.

struct.name: override_sdds_header
struct.description: Used to optionally override values in the SDDS header which would otherwise be derived from BulkIO metadata or set to a reasonable value.

simple.name: enabled
simple.description: If true, the values in this struct will override the default values used by this component. Each property should have a description which explains what values would otherwise be used.

simple.name: dmode
simple.description: The data mode field identifies the structure of the data field. See the full specification for details. Unless overridden, this is set to 1 for byte samples, 2 for shorts, and 0 for floats as floats are not part of the standadr.

simple.name: bps
simple.description: The number of bits per sample where the sample size in this case is only refering to the size of the native type used eg. byte, short, float. Bytes are 8, Shorts 16, and since only 5 bits are available, a float is labeled as 31 rather than 32. Unless overridden, this is derived from the sizeof call on the native bulkIO packet type.

simple.name: cx
simple.description: Denotes if the data portion of the packet represents real (0) or complex (1) values. Unless overridden, this is derived from the mode field within the SRI.

simple.name: msv
simple.description: Denotes if the samples within this packet span a 1-millisecond boundry. Unless overridden, this field is not used and set to zero.

simple.name: ttv
simple.description: Time Tag Valid field denotes if the values stored within the Time Tag information fields (Time Tag, Time Tag Extension) are valid. Unless overridden, this is derived from the tcstatus field of BulkIO Timestamps and is set to true if equal to TCS_VALID and false otherwise.

simple.name: sscv
simple.description: Synchronous Sample Clock Valid field is 1 if the SSC information fields (df/dt and Frequency) are valid and zero otherwise. Unless overridden, this is always set to 1.

simple.name: msptr
simple.description: Points to the first sample in the data field that occurred after the 1-millisecond event. Unless overridden, this is always set to 0.

simple.name: msdel
simple.description: The 1-ms Delta is the time difference between the 1-millisecond event and the first positive going transistion of the SSC that occurred after the 1-millisecond event. Unless overridden, this is always set to 0.

simple.name: frequency
simple.description: The frequency field contains the frequency of the SSC. This value represents the instantaneous frqeuency of the SSC associated with the first sample of the frame. Unless overridden, this is derived from the xdelta found in the SRI.

simple.name: dfdt
simple.description: The df/dt field measures the rate at which the frequency is changing. The value represents the delta between the instantaneous frequency of the last SSC of the packet and the instantaneous frequency of the first SSC of the packet divided by the packet duration. Unless overridden, this is set to 0.0

simple.name: current_stream
simple.description: The current stream being processed by the stream processor.

simple.name: stream_on_deck
simple.description: If there is a stream being processed any new stream started will be put "on deck" until it can become active. Only a single stream can be on deck at any time and old streams are dropped when new streams arrive.
